## Steps to reproduce

Sorry if this is a duplicate issue.

1.  Start PowerShell 7 as a regular user (i.e., not an administrator) from the Start Menu (e.g., press Windows key, type "powershell", left-click PowerShell 7).
2.  Right-click top of window, select "Properties."
3.  Change a setting (e.g., Opacity in the "Colors" tab).
4.  Click "OK".

## Expected behavior

The Properties window closes, any changes are saved and persist in future sessions.

## Actual behavior

The following error message window pops up:
```none
Unable to modify the shortcut: C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\PowerShell\PowerShell 7 (x64).lnk. Check to make sure it has not been deleted or renamed.
```

Changes to properties do not persist in future sessions.

Strangely enough, when opening PowerShell 7 via the context menu, whether or not you choose to run as an administrator, the expected behavior happens.

## Environment data


comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
It is how MSI works. The shortcut is protected by OS permissions.
You can create a custom shortcut and modify its properties.
